thread.title: Chilcot inquiry report to be handed over in fortnight but we still don't know when it'll be published
thread.title_full: Chilcot inquiry report to be handed over in fortnight but we still don't know when it'll be published - Mirror Online

author: Ben Glaze
title: Chilcot inquiry report to be handed over in fortnight but we still don't know when it'll be published
text:
Iraq inquiry chairman Sir John Chilcot has finally agreed to set a date for handing over his long-delayed report into the war.
He will write to David Cameron by November 3 with a “realistic timetable” for publication.
But, crucially, he will still not say exactly when his report will be revealed.
His six-year, £10million probe has been plagued by setbacks which have enraged families of the 179 British servicemen killed in the US-led invasion.
Sir John’s announcement came just days before the expiry of a deadline set by grieving relatives of troops killed in action.
Daily Mirror Iraq War: A direct hit on Saddam's riverside Presidential Palace in 2003
In a letter to families, the retired civil servant pledged to “write to the Prime Minister with a realistic timetable for delivery of the inquiry report (for national security checking, an essential process for any inquiry which draws on highly-classified material)”.
Mr Cameron admitted at this week’s Prime Minister’s Questions that he “can’t wait” for Sir John’s investigation to come out.
Meanwhile, on October 22, former Attorney General Lord Morris of Aberavon QC will lead a 90-minute Lords debate on whether to sack Sir John and his panel for their failure to produce a speedier report.
